title: Ticket #1194: Build new ClassAds only as an external
description:
Currently, we build two versions of new ClassAds when building Condor. One is an external and is used to build the Blahp and Cream externals. The other is in src/classad and is used to build the Condor daemons and tools. There should be one version of new ClassAds, built as an external, used to build Condor.

Issues

libcondorapi

The main complicating factor in building ClassAds just as an external is libcondorapi, the library we provide to users to read and write user logs. Currently, it directly includes the new ClassAds object files and has no dependencies other than system libraries.

With new ClassAds built only as an external, we'll need to provide libclassad in the release as an additional library for users to link against. New ClassAds themselves depend on PCRE, though libcondorapi's usage of ClassAds should never result in PCRE being called. Currently, libcondorapi includes stubs for the PCRE functions which call abort(). With an external-only ClassAds, we'll need to provide libpcre in the release or figure out how to make stubs work.

We provide both static and dynamic versions of libcondorapi. For the dynamic version, we may have to set up relative rpaths for libcondorapi and libclassad in order for them to find libclassad and libpcre, respectively. Also, creating a shared version of libclassad currently fails on Solaris.

Windows

We would also need to change the Windows build to build ClassAds as an external.
